body.name: TECKNET Ergonomic Mouse, 4800 DPI Silent Mouse 5 Adjustable DPI, Wireless Mouse 2.4G Vertical Mouse 6 Buttons Computer Mouse Wide Compatibility, Black
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 2 hrs 19 mins
features: [Higher DPI & 5 Adjustable Level] - DPI: 4800/3200/2400/1600/800. This wireless mouse can meet your daily needs with its 5 adjustable DPI settings. Upgraded technology allows this ergonomic mouse to run smoothly on different types of surfaces. When the DPI is changed, the light will flicker, and the number of flickers corresponds to the DPI level.

[Silent Mouse] - This computer mouse is silent, allowing for use even in quiet environments like libraries. Additionally, the vertical mouse results in almost silent clicking, which avoids disturbing others and ensures that your work or study is not interrupted.

[Ergonomic Design] - The cordless mouse is ergonomically designed so that your palm is positioned close to a vertical angle with the desktop, reducing pressure and pain on the wrist caused by holding the mouse in an inverted position for prolonged periods.

[Wide Compatibility & Low Power Warning] - The wireless computer mouse is compatible with various devices including Windows/Mac/Chrome/Linux/laptop/computer. (Side buttons are not compatible with macOS) Additionally, the wireless mouse for laptop has low energy consumption and enters sleep mode after a few seconds of inactivity. Pressing any button will wake it up, with up to 24 months of battery life. When the battery is low, an LED light will flash. (2 X AAA batteries not included)

[Plug & Play] - This wireless ergonomic mouse is extremely convenient to use - simply plug in the receiver and turn on the switch, and you can start using it without needing to install any drivers. The silent wireless mouse is smooth and durable, providing you with long-lasting use.

[36 MONTHS SUPPORT] - If you encounter any problems in using the tecknet wireless mouse, please feel free to contact our professional customer service team, enjoying TECKNET 36 Months Warranty (Registered Only)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Silent Mouse The silent mouse is ideal for quiet environments such as cafes, and produces almost no clicking noise which minimizes interruptions and disturbances.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Takes some time to get use to
reviews.reviewText: I really like this mouse. I do have a couple of issues but they are mine and not the mouse. It is a little big for my hand and sometime I can't get it to click because my index finger isn't long enough to click up by the scrool wheel and I have to adjust my "grip" so it will work. The other thing is, it is taller than a regular mouse and I find myself knocking it over when I move my right hand from the keyboard to the mouse. I am sure this will pass as I get more accustomed to it's hight. Response time is excellant. Comfortable to use and very natural grip. Hoping it helps with my carpel tunnel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great comfort at a good price.
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely love the vertical mouse. It keeps the pressure off my wrist and allows for a more efficient workday. I've also had no issues with connection to computers. Can't beat the price either. I would buy the mouse again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good value and comfortable feel
reviews.reviewText: This replaced a similar style mouse so I have no issue with how it feels and it feels good to use. As reported by others, the light doesn't work to tell you it's on. I just have to remember to turn it off when I'm done but having that light would be a nice reminder. I use this mouse on Windows using 3 screens (2 large external and laptop screen) in total and have no issues with speed or tracking as reported by others. However, sometimes the dongle seems to need to be re-plugged in for the mouse to work. Overall, I'm happy with it. Hopefully it doesn't die soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It fits my hand and works better than expected! I got MORE than what I paid for!
reviews.reviewText: I received this over the weekend and needed a new gaming mouse.I'm a 45+ year gamer (Magnavox Odyssey) was my first and so a mouse isn't going to add to my game play that much. I used the famous Logitech MX518 for YEARS and watched it go up in value to $250 (I paid only $39 when I purchased it new) and that thing was AWESOME! It took me over 12 years to finally destroy it.That said, I bought this mouse because I needed something with the side back/forward controls and the ergonomics looked good on it. Problem is, there was no way to tell how big or small it was from the photo.Well, I can tell you this... I have man hands, bear paws, and this thing fits like a GLOVE!It doesn't have a super high "hump" that raising your palm, my thumb hits the side buttons perfect and it is stable and accurate when firing on the battlefield.Oh, and the drivers... NOT necessary... worked right out of the box, HOWEVER, I recommend the drivers as they let you customize the color scheme, button assignment and DPI per click on the 7 way dpi setting. The driver file is SMALL, not bloatware (like Logitech G for headphones at a whopping 150mb, this was only like 6mb?) and it did exactly what it said it would, immediately.For what I paid, I GOT MORE than what I paid for and VERY, VERY pleased!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best mouse ever....
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this due to the carpal tunnel issues I've been having. This style mouse was a recommendation. It took a day for me to get used to it. The mouse texture itself is great for gripping and cleaning as well.I have not had any discomfort using this mouse. It's my favorite laptop accessory now and I get asked about it often. Def worth it for preventative measures and if you have existing hand issues from computer work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty good mouse
reviews.reviewText: Having tried quite a few mice, ergonomic and otherwise, this is the best so far.It is very responsive, very comfortable, has lots of buttons, seems very well designed and well built, the charge lasts a very long time (a few weeks at least) and it is economically priced. And it has been very reliable.One feature to be aware of is that it takes a very long time to charge (hours) even on a fast charger. Fortunately it is rare that it needs a charge, even with all day use. Suggestion: keep a spare around for those rare occasions.Identifies as Newmen Tech.,LTD 2.4G Wireless Mouse, but not found on the Newmen website.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Gave me 3 arthritic fingers!
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Amazon review since I became a member more than 10 years ago, meaning that this mouse is so bad, detrimental to health to the extent that I am compelled to report and let others know about the danger of using this product. I bought this mouse because I have small hands and someone recommended it stating it's a perfect fit to her small hand. So, I bought it on May 1, this year.First off, this mouse is pretty heavy, so burdens my hand when I move it around. Speaking of its design, it's pretty bulky and poorly made, so when you use fingers (thumb, index and the middle finger), you really need to apply pressure on your fingers. I didn't feel comfortable when I started to use it, but continue to use it to my regret. In one month, I had developed severe inflammation on my thumb, with my bone sticking out as well as minor inflammation on index and middle fingers.Now that Amazon return period is over, I have to throw it out. Wasting money is one thing, but developing three arthritic fingers really piss me off. I did not return it right away as I returned one mouse just before I bought this one. That's why I pushed myself to use it. I've been using various mouses for almost 3 decades, and this is the worst, ABSOLUTELY THE WORST EVER mouse. So, others beware!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Ergonomic, but track is too slow
reviews.reviewText: I really like how this mouse feels, however the track is too slow. I have two monitors and I have to pick up the mouse twice for it to track completely over. I've adjusted the speeds and tried on both Mac & Windows- still very slow tracking.The point is to take pressure off my wrist, not to need to pick it up. My standard wireless mouse works better, unfortunately. I would not recommend if your screen is over 13"
This mouse functions great for what I need. It feels great and the clicks are quiet as promised!

Below the Asterisks is my original review. Comfort wise the mouse is good. However, you can't earn more than a star if the item refuses to stay connected after 2 months.Curiously, I looked at some of the other reviews where they have the same connectivity issues as I am having, and they all look to occur within a few weeks of the Amazon return window (about 2 to 3 months).I really like the design of the mouse, and the tactile feel, so I would be willing to try a replacement and hope they just have some duds in their batches. Still trying to figure out how to contact them for a replacement.The issue is that the mouse stops working after less than a minute of activity. Turn off, turn on, working for less than a minute again. I thought it might be driver issues so tried it on both windows 7 and windows 10. Both are exhibiting the identical connectivity problems. Looks like I have a new $50 paperweight.**************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************So, overall I would give 3.5 stars, not 4 out of 5. But I errored towards higher since it's hand size dependent.After less than a week of use. I suspect it would be very comfortable for those with small, or medium-small hands. But it is still a full sized mouse. Not a laptop or reduced form factor mouse.THE GOODRUBBERIZED: The finish quality is excellent. The rubberized finish should be on all mouses to allow the hand to rest comfortably and not require extra flexing to keep hand from sliding. Especially on vertical mouses. This one has a nice silky rubberized finish on the thumb and the buttons. Not gross rubbery like some. For those concerned about this finish becoming sticky, regular (every 3 to 6 months?) treatment with Talcum or baby powder keeps this finish from deteriorating. This goes for all mouses and tools like yard tools with rubberized handles. In some cases, it can even restore a finish that's started to get sticky.BACK/FORWARD THUMB CLICK BUTTONS: Very nicely placed, a nice ridge that gives your thumb a good sense of the button, and a nice feel to the click. Silent.CLICKING (right / left click buttons): Nice feel, and nice firmness to avoid accidental clicks which frequently happens to me with vertical mouses. Hope it lasts. Also, very quiet. Near silent.SCROLL WHEEL: Adequate. Default speed is good. Maybe a little loose. Could use a more clicky feel to the roll, but that's just preference. It's not free rolling which is good. But I do have a slight suspicion this might be a mechanical component that won't last.ERGONOMICS (small hands): I suspect this would be extremely comfortable for smaller hands. I have short, but wider medium hands. Male.USB-C cable included: time for companies to start including this. micro-USB is disappearing. And plugging in USB-C is much smoother due to no up or down direction.THE MEDIOCREERGONOMICS (medium hands): It's not bad. A bit larger, and slightly more palm support and it would be perfect. Almost wide enough (could use about 10mm to 15mm more width on the pinky side where it starts to jut out horizontally). Still, the contour on that little pinky plate is very nice. Just needed to jut out to the right a bit more to support the pinky side of the hand fully. For length, just a little on the short side by approx. 1 inch (25mm). All these vertical mouses should have palm support for stability and downward pressure, but few do. This mouse is not exception. A bit small for my medium sized hand (see photos). And I would like even more doming on the pointer 1st click button so that finger rested on the button more. This would allow for a more vertical feel to this button without having to make the whole mouse aggressively vertical like some. But doming is still better than most in this department. At least it doesn't slope aggressively to the desk like most logitech mouses. Could be slightly more vertical, but I would prefer more doming on the left click instead (see photo of space below my finger and left click).DPI BUTTON: A button I never use. But it never lets me forget it's there. Very high, and can always feel it when using the scroll wheel. And no indication of the current DPI settings for those who do use it.DRIVERS?: Are there even any available to allow customization? Nothing in the manual or the cheep OEM box it shipped in.NO BLUETOOTH: but that's expected at this price point. Not a true negative, just informing people that it's not included. 10 dollars more and it should be included.THE BADSLEEP MODE: It's confusing at first, and almost made me return the mouse. I had to read the fine print on the instructions to realize the issue. Most mice will wake up with movement. This one requires a click to wake. So good to have sleep for battery life, but I almost returned the mouse thinking it was defective. Either add movement wake, or a clear logo on the top of the mouse stating: "click to wake". If this had been clear, I would have listed this as mediocre, not bad. Don't expect people to read instructions for basic mouse functionality. Most will only read them to get more in-depth feature instructions. We're all to use to mouse operation now. No one reads the instructions on a pen package. Almost wasted my time returning the mouse. But will keep now, unless something else crops up.All in all, for the price, a very good mouse. You would be pressed to find a decent flat mouse at this price. But well priced. Competitors are over priced and silly margins.A note about my photos: I didn't take fresh photos with the rulers since photos with scale can be deceptive due to perspective. I included photos that show other mouses with proper ruler scales and guides to eliminate perspective confusion, and then added the Tecknet mouse to a photo side by side with those other mouses to give a sense of its true size. I think this will give a better sense than a photo with a ruler alone. I don't have time today to do a proper scale setting with all the paper strips which help avoid perspective problems in photos with rulers. The paper strips in the old photos without the tecknet mouse are lined up exactly with the body of the mouse at it's most extreme length or width (not including the thumb rest on the unimouse contour mouse - far left). The perspectives in the photos are a bit deceptive since it looks like the mouse edges go past the paper strips. They do not. The place the paper meets the ruler/tape measure is the true edge of the mouse.

reviews.reviewTitle: Ergonomisch, angenehm, genau und auch noch günstig!
reviews.reviewText: Die Maus dient mir für Arbeiten am Laptop. Sie ist genau, ruckelt nicht und macht das, was sie soll. Der Preis war, im Vergleich zu anderen, überzeugend. Sie liegt gut in der Hand. Ich denke, alles richtig gemacht!

reviews.reviewTitle: Ergonomía, Calidad y Funcionalidad en un Solo Dispositivo
reviews.reviewText: El Ratón Vertical Inalámbrico TECKNET 2.4G es una verdadera pasada.Desde el momento en que lo sostienes, te das cuenta de que estás tratando con un producto de calidad excepcional. Una de las características más destacadas de este ratón es la calidad de sus materiales. La sensación de solidez y durabilidad es evidente, lo que te proporciona la tranquilidad de que estás invirtiendo en un producto que resistirá el paso del tiempo.Una de las cosas que más sorprende al utilizar este ratón es lo rápido y silenciosos que son sus botones. Cada clic se siente preciso y suave, lo que mejora la experiencia de uso. Los 6 botones proporcionan una flexibilidad adicional para las tareas diarias, desde navegar por la web hasta realizar tareas de productividad.El diseño es moderno y atractivo, lo que lo convierte en un accesorio agradable a la vista en cualquier escritorio. Además, este ratón es eficiente en el uso de energía, ya que las pilas duran sorprendentemente mucho tiempo, lo que significa que no tendrás que preocuparte por cambiarlas constantemente.Un aspecto realmente útil de este ratón son sus indicadores luminosos, que te mantienen informado sobre el nivel de batería y la configuración de DPI. Puedes ajustar los niveles de DPI a tu preferencia con facilidad, lo que lo hace adecuado para una variedad de tareas, desde trabajos de precisión hasta desplazamiento rápido por la web.El punto más fuerte de este ratón es su diseño ergonómico vertical. Su forma se adapta perfectamente a la mano, eliminando la tensión en la muñeca y el antebrazo. Sin embargo, es importante destacar que, si vienes de usar otro tipo de ratones, puede llevar un poco tiempo acostumbrarse a esta nueva ergonomía. Los botones de avance y retroceso, ubicados en el lateral so los que me han costado más para utilizarlos.En resumen, el Ratón Vertical Inalámbrico TECKNET 2.4G es una opción excelente para quienes buscan un ratón ergonómico de alta calidad. Con materiales duraderos, botones rápidos y silenciosos, diseño atractivo, duración de pilas, indicadores luminosos y configuración de DPI personalizable, este ratón tiene mucho que ofrecer.Encontrarás con un compañero de trabajo o juego que cuidará de tu comodidad y salud a largo plazo.Lo recomiendo sin dudarlo.
